meanings.definition: To work harder or more efficiently than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outworked her classmates to finish the project first.
meanings.sent2: He always outworked his competitors to win the race.
meanings.sent3: The little ant outworked the lazy grasshopper in gathering food.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outworked any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The sun outworked the clouds, shining brightly in the sky.

meanings.sent1: The new machine outworked the old one, producing more in less time.
meanings.sent2: She outworked all expectations by completing the task ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The student outworked the teacher, finishing the assignment before anyone else.
meanings.sent4: His dedication outworked any doubts, proving his capabilities.
meanings.sent5: The river outworked its banks, flooding the surrounding area.

meanings.sent1: The long hours outworked him, leaving him tired and drained.
meanings.sent2: She outworked herself trying to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The demanding job outworked his energy, making him feel worn out.
meanings.sent4: The intense training outworked his muscles, causing soreness.
meanings.sent5: The constant overtime outworked his enthusiasm, leading to burnout.
